metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the unix-def:process_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the unix-def:process_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the process_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value.
Test that the process_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the process_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.

process_test.comment: Test that the process_object is supported with the name entity equal to some value.
Test that the process_object is supported with the name entity not equal to some value.
Test that the process_object is supported with the name entity matching some regular expression.

process_object.comment: Retrieve an process_item with a name equal to 'hald'.
Retrieve process_items with names that are not equal to 'hald'.
Retrieve process_items with names that match the regular expression '^ha.d$'.

process_state.comment: This state represents an process_item that has a name equal to 'hald'.
This state represents process_items that have a name not equal to 'hald'.
This state represents process_items that have a name that matches the regular expression '^ha.d$'.
